citations.narrative:
Three adult llamas escaped from their enclosure on 09-May-2025. Control over the animals was lost while the facility was
moving the animals from one enclosure to another. The animals were able to enter areas that were not intended for
animal housing. APHIS officials reviewed a video that depicts the three llamas (Sky, Gandalf, and Dante) running
alongside a stopped train carrying park guests. Facility representatives stated that both the rides in that area and the train
were halted following the escape. Failure to ensure that animals are handled with minimal risk to the animal and to the
public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers can result in animal/human injury, and disease exposure. The facility must
ensure that during public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the
public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the
safety of animals and the public. Correct by, 02-June-2025.

An indoor enclosure for one adult male turkey had sharp points present. There were sharp points along the bottom of the
wire mesh of the enclosure and bent nails sticking out of a wooden support beam. Facility maintenance staff repaired the
enclosure at the time of inspection. Failure to ensure that no sharp points are present in enclosures housing birds can
result in injuries to the birds. Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are
structurally sound. Correct by ensuring that all primary enclosures are kept in good repair and are free of sharp points or
edges that could injure birds. Correct by, 02-June-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Repeat
   
Handling of animals. 
Three adult llamas escaped from their enclosure on 09-May-2025. Control over the animals was lost while the facility was 
moving the animals from one enclosure to another. The animals were able to enter areas that were not intended for 
animal housing. APHIS officials reviewed a video that depicts the three llamas (Sky, Gandalf, and Dante) running 
alongside a stopped train carrying park guests. Facility representatives stated that both the rides in that area and the train 
were halted following the escape. Failure to ensure that animals are handled with minimal risk to the animal and to the 
public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers can result in animal/human injury, and disease exposure. The facility must 
ensure that during public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the 
public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the 
safety of animals and the public. Correct by, 02-June-2025. 
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
An indoor enclosure for one adult male turkey had sharp points present. There were sharp points along the bottom of the 
wire mesh of the enclosure and bent nails sticking out of a wooden support beam. Facility maintenance staff repaired the 
enclosure at the time of inspection. Failure to ensure that no sharp points are present in enclosures housing birds can 
result in injuries to the birds. Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are 
structurally sound. Correct by ensuring that all primary enclosures are kept in good repair and are free of sharp points or 
edges that could injure birds. Correct by, 02-June-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative. 
 
 n
